intro: Bulbocodium versicolor, commonly known as the variable bulbous bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous roots and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers range in color from white to pink and blue, depending on the environmental conditions. Bulbocodium versicolor is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it contributes to the biodiversity of mountainous ecosystems.
